definitions.definition: a large public meeting, especially one held to support a particular idea or political party

examples.text: a **mass rally** in support of the strike
She spoke at a public rally in Hyde Park.
The demonstrators marched to Trafalgar Square where they held a rally.
The rally dispersed peacefully after six hours.
a massive outdoor rally in Buenos Aires
a rally calling for a boycott of the January elections
a rally for the winning candidate

definitions.definition: a race for cars, motorcycles, etc. over public roads

examples.text: He will join the team at the rally next week.

definitions.definition: a series of hits of the ball before a point is scored
an act of returning to a strong position after a period of difficulty or weakness

examples.text: After a furious late rally, they finally scored.
a rally in shares on the stock market
The visiting team staged a late rally.
The US dollar is now ending its bear-market rally.
the recent rally in the Treasury market

wordOrigin: early 17th cent. (in the sense ‘bring together again’): from French rallier, from re- ‘again’ + allier ‘to ally’.
